trans-unit.source: Understand Azure Data Factory datasets and learn how to create them.
trans-unit.target: Understand Azure Data Factory datasets and learn how to create them.

trans-unit.source: A Dataset is a logical description of the data.
trans-unit.target: A Dataset is a logical description of the data.

trans-unit.source: The data being described can vary from simple bytes, semi-structured data like CSV files all the way up to relational tables or even models.
trans-unit.target: The data being described can vary from simple bytes, semi-structured data like CSV files all the way up to relational tables or even models.

trans-unit.source: The mechanism (address, protocol, authentication scheme) to access the data is defined in the Linked Service and referenced in the dataset definition.
trans-unit.target: The mechanism (address, protocol, authentication scheme) to access the data is defined in the Linked Service and referenced in the dataset definition.

trans-unit.source: See [Dataset Structure](#Structure) section for more details
trans-unit.target: See [Dataset Structure](#Structure) section for more details

trans-unit.source: Properties corresponding to the selected type
trans-unit.target: Properties corresponding to the selected type

trans-unit.source: See [Dataset Type](#Type) section for details on the supported types and their properties.
trans-unit.target: See [Dataset Type](#Type) section for details on the supported types and their properties.

trans-unit.source: Boolean flag to specify whether a dataset is explicitly produced by a data factory pipeline or not
trans-unit.target: Boolean flag to specify whether a dataset is explicitly produced by a data factory pipeline or not

trans-unit.source: Defines the processing window or the slicing model for the dataset production.
trans-unit.target: Defines the processing window or the slicing model for the dataset production.

trans-unit.source: See [Dataset Availability](#Availability) topic for more details
trans-unit.target: See [Dataset Availability](#Availability) topic for more details

trans-unit.source: See [Scheduling and Execution](data-factory-scheduling-and-execution.md) article for more details on the dataset slicing model
trans-unit.target: See [Scheduling and Execution](data-factory-scheduling-and-execution.md) article for more details on the dataset slicing model

trans-unit.source: Defines the criteria or the condition that the dataset slices must fulfill.
trans-unit.target: Defines the criteria or the condition that the dataset slices must fulfill.

trans-unit.source: See [Dataset Policy](#Policy) topic for more details
trans-unit.target: See [Dataset Policy](#Policy) topic for more details

trans-unit.source: Below is an example of a dataset representing a table named **MyTable** in **Azure SQL database**.
trans-unit.target: Below is an example of a dataset representing a table named **MyTable** in **Azure SQL database**.

trans-unit.source: The Azure SQL database connection strings are defined in the **AzureSqlLinkedService** referenced in this dataset.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SQL database connection strings are defined in the **AzureSqlLinkedService** referenced in this dataset.

trans-unit.source: The **Structure** section asserts the schema of the dataset.
trans-unit.target: The **Structure** section asserts the schema of the dataset.

trans-unit.source: It contains the collection of the columns and the type of these columns.
trans-unit.target: It contains the collection of the columns and the type of these columns.

trans-unit.source: Each column contains the following properties:
trans-unit.target: Each column contains the following properties:

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the dataset has three columns slicetimestamp, projectname, and pageviews.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the dataset has three columns slicetimestamp, projectname, and pageviews.

trans-unit.source: The supported data sources and the dataset types are aligned.
trans-unit.target: The supported data sources and the dataset types are aligned.

trans-unit.source: See the connector topics referenced in the [Data Movement Activities](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md) article for information on the types and configuration of datasets.
trans-unit.target: See the connector topics referenced in the [Data Movement Activities](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md) article for information on the types and configuration of datasets.

trans-unit.source: The Availability section in a dataset defines the processing window or the slicing model for the dataset production.
trans-unit.target: The Availability section in a dataset defines the processing window or the slicing model for the dataset production.

trans-unit.source: See Dataset Slice topic for more details on the dataset slicing and dependency model.
trans-unit.target: See Dataset Slice topic for more details on the dataset slicing and dependency model.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the time unit for dataset slice production.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the time unit for dataset slice production.

trans-unit.source: **Supported frequency**: Minute, Hour, Day, Week, Month
trans-unit.target: **Supported frequency**: Minute, Hour, Day, Week, Month

trans-unit.source: ”Frequency x interval” determines how often the slice is produced.
trans-unit.target: ”Frequency x interval” determines how often the slice is produced.

trans-unit.source: If you need the dataset to be sliced on an hourly basis, you set **Frequency** to **Hour**, and **interval** to **1**.
trans-unit.target: If you need the dataset to be sliced on an hourly basis, you set **Frequency** to **Hour**, and **interval** to **1**.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** If you specify Frequency as Minute, we recommend that you set the interval to no less than 15
trans-unit.target: **Note:** If you specify Frequency as Minute, we recommend that you set the interval to no less than 15

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the slice should be produced at the start/end of the interval.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the slice should be produced at the start/end of the interval.

trans-unit.source: If Frequency is set to Month and style is set to EndOfInterval, the slice is produced on the last day of month.
trans-unit.target: If Frequency is set to Month and style is set to EndOfInterval, the slice is produced on the last day of month.

trans-unit.source: If the style is set to StartOfInterval, the slice is produced on the first day of moth.<.p>
trans-unit.target: If the style is set to StartOfInterval, the slice is produced on the first day of moth.<.p>

trans-unit.source: If Frequency is set to Day and style is set to EndOfInterval, the slice is produced in the last hour of the day.
trans-unit.target: If Frequency is set to Day and style is set to EndOfInterval, the slice is produced in the last hour of the day.

trans-unit.source: If Frequency is set to Hour and style is set to EndOfInterval, the slice is produced at the end of the hour.
trans-unit.target: If Frequency is set to Hour and style is set to EndOfInterval, the slice is produced at the end of the hour.

trans-unit.source: For example, for a slice for 1 PM – 2 PM period, the slice is produced at 2 PM.
trans-unit.target: For example, for a slice for 1 PM – 2 PM period, the slice is produced at 2 PM.

trans-unit.source: Defines the absolute position in time used by scheduler to compute dataset slice boundaries.
trans-unit.target: Defines the absolute position in time used by scheduler to compute dataset slice boundaries.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** If the AnchorDateTime has date parts that are more granular than the frequency then the more granular parts will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** If the AnchorDateTime has date parts that are more granular than the frequency then the more granular parts will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the **interval** is **hourly** (frequency: hour and interval: 1) and the **AnchorDateTime** contains **minutes and seconds**, then the **minutes and seconds** parts of the AnchorDateTime will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the **interval** is **hourly** (frequency: hour and interval: 1) and the **AnchorDateTime** contains **minutes and seconds**, then the **minutes and seconds** parts of the AnchorDateTime will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: Timespan by which the start and end of all dataset slices are shifted.
trans-unit.target: Timespan by which the start and end of all dataset slices are shifted.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** If both anchorDateTime and offset are specified, the result is the combined shift.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** If both anchorDateTime and offset are specified, the result is the combined shift.

trans-unit.source: **Example:** 23 hours dataset slices that starts on 2007-04-19T08:00:00
trans-unit.target: **Example:** 23 hours dataset slices that starts on 2007-04-19T08:00:00

trans-unit.source: Daily slices that starts at 6 AM instead of the default midnight.
trans-unit.target: Daily slices that starts at 6 AM instead of the default midnight.

trans-unit.source: In this case, SliceStart is shifted by 6 hours and will be 6 AM.
trans-unit.target: In this case, SliceStart is shifted by 6 hours and will be 6 AM.

trans-unit.source: For a 12 month (frequency = month; interval = 12) schedule, offset: 60.00:00:00 means every year on March 2nd or 3rd (60 days from the beginning of the year if style = StartOfInterval), depending on the year being leap year or not.
trans-unit.target: For a 12 month (frequency = month; interval = 12) schedule, offset: 60.00:00:00 means every year on March 2nd or 3rd (60 days from the beginning of the year if style = StartOfInterval), depending on the year being leap year or not.

trans-unit.source: The Policy section in the dataset defines the criteria or the condition that the dataset slices must fulfill.
trans-unit.target: The Policy section in the dataset defines the criteria or the condition that the dataset slices must fulfill.

trans-unit.source: Validates that the data in an Azure blob meets the minimum size requirements (in megabytes).
trans-unit.target: Validates that the data in an Azure blob meets the minimum size requirements (in megabytes).

trans-unit.source: Validates that the data in an Azure SQL database or an Azure table contains the minimum number of rows.
trans-unit.target: Validates that the data in an Azure SQL database or an Azure table contains the minimum number of rows.

trans-unit.source: External datasets are ones that are not produced by a running pipeline in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: External datasets are ones that are not produced by a running pipeline in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: If the dataset is marked as External, the ExternalData policy may be defined to influence the behavior of the dataset slice availability.
trans-unit.target: If the dataset is marked as External, the ExternalData policy may be defined to influence the behavior of the dataset slice availability.

trans-unit.source: Time to delay the check on the availability of the external data for the given slice.
trans-unit.target: Time to delay the check on the availability of the external data for the given slice.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the data is supposed to be available hourly, the check to see the external data is actually available and the corresponding slice is Ready can be delayed by dataDelay.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the data is supposed to be available hourly, the check to see the external data is actually available and the corresponding slice is Ready can be delayed by dataDelay.

trans-unit.source: Only applies to the present time; for example, if it is 1:00 PM right now and this value is 10 minutes, the validation will start at 1:10 PM.
trans-unit.target: Only applies to the present time; for example, if it is 1:00 PM right now and this value is 10 minutes, the validation will start at 1:10 PM.

trans-unit.source: This setting does not affect slices in the past (slices with Slice End Time + dataDelay < Now) will be processed without any delay.
trans-unit.target: This setting does not affect slices in the past (slices with Slice End Time + dataDelay < Now) will be processed without any delay.

trans-unit.source: Time greater than 23:59 hours need to specified using the day.hours:minutes:seconds format.
trans-unit.target: Time greater than 23:59 hours need to specified using the day.hours:minutes:seconds format.

trans-unit.source: For example, to specify 24 hours, don't use 24:00:00; instead, use 1.00:00:00.
trans-unit.target: For example, to specify 24 hours, don't use 24:00:00; instead, use 1.00:00:00.

trans-unit.source: If you use 24:00:00, it will be treated as 24 days (24.00:00:00).
trans-unit.target: If you use 24:00:00, it will be treated as 24 days (24.00:00:00).

trans-unit.source: The wait time between a failure and the next retry attempt.
trans-unit.target: The wait time between a failure and the next retry attempt.

trans-unit.source: Applies to present time; if the previous try failed, we wait this long after the last try.
trans-unit.target: Applies to present time; if the previous try failed, we wait this long after the last try.

trans-unit.source: If it is 1:00pm right now, we will begin the first try.
trans-unit.target: If it is 1:00pm right now, we will begin the first try.

trans-unit.source: If the duration to complete the first validation check is 1 minute and the operation failed, the next retry will be at 1:00 + 1min (duration) + 1min (retry interval) = 1:02pm.
trans-unit.target: If the duration to complete the first validation check is 1 minute and the operation failed, the next retry will be at 1:00 + 1min (duration) + 1min (retry interval) = 1:02pm.

trans-unit.source: For slices in the past, there will be no delay.
trans-unit.target: For slices in the past, there will be no delay.

trans-unit.source: The timeout for each retry attempt.
trans-unit.target: The timeout for each retry attempt.

trans-unit.source: If this is set to 10 minutes, the validation needs to be completed within 10 minutes.
trans-unit.target: If this is set to 10 minutes, the validation needs to be completed within 10 minutes.

trans-unit.source: If it takes longer than 10 minutes to perform the validation, the retry will time out.
trans-unit.target: If it takes longer than 10 minutes to perform the validation, the retry will time out.

trans-unit.source: If all attempts for the validation times out, the slice will be marked as TimedOut.
trans-unit.target: If all attempts for the validation times out, the slice will be marked as TimedOut.

trans-unit.source: Number of times to check for the availability of the external data.
trans-unit.target: Number of times to check for the availability of the external data.

trans-unit.source: If you need to run a pipeline on monthly basis on specific date and time (suppose on 3rd of every month at 8:00 AM), you could use the **offset** tag to set the date and time it should run.
trans-unit.target: If you need to run a pipeline on monthly basis on specific date and time (suppose on 3rd of every month at 8:00 AM), you could use the **offset** tag to set the date and time it should run.

trans-unit.source: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.
trans-unit.target: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.

trans-unit.source: Please take a few minutes to submit your feedback via [email](mailto:adfdocfeedback@microsoft.com?subject=data-factory-create-datasets.md).
trans-unit.target: Please take a few minutes to submit your feedback via [email](mailto:adfdocfeedback@microsoft.com?subject=data-factory-create-datasets.md).
